{{Day}}

==Events==
*  [[41]] &ndash; [[Roman Emperor]] [[Caligula]], known for his [[Eccentricity (behavior)|eccentricity]] and sadistic [[despotism]], is [[assassination|assassin]]ated by his disgruntled [[Praetorian Guard]]s. The Guard then proclaims Caligula's uncle [[Claudius]] as Emperor
*[[1438]] &ndash; The [[Council of Basel]] suspends [[Pope Eugene IV]].
*[[1458]] &ndash; [[Matthias I Corvinus of Hungary|Matthias I Corvinus]] becomes king of [[Hungary]].
*[[1624]] &ndash; [[Afonso Mendes]], appointed by [[Pope Gregory XV]] as [[Prelate]] of [[Ethiopia]], arrives at [[Massawa]] from [[Goa]].
*[[1679]] &ndash; King [[Charles II of England]] dissolves the [[Cavalier Parliament]].
*[[1742]] &ndash; [[Charles VII, Holy Roman Emperor|Charles VII Albert]] becomes [[Holy Roman Emperor]].
*[[1758]] &ndash; During the [[Seven Years' War]] the leading burghers of [[Königsberg]] submit to [[Elizabeth I of Russia]], thus forming [[Russian Prussia]] (until 1763)
*[[1817]] &ndash; [[Crossing of the Andes]]: Many soldiers of [[Juan Gregorio de las Heras]] are captured during the [[Action of Picheuta]].
*[[1835]] &ndash; Slaves in [[Salvador da Bahia]], Brazil, [[Malê Revolt|stage a revolt]], which is instrumental in ending slavery there 50 years later.
*[[1848]] &ndash; [[California Gold Rush]]: [[James W. Marshall]] finds [[gold]] at [[Sutter's Mill]] near [[Sacramento, California|Sacramento]].
*[[1857]] &ndash; The [[University of Calcutta]] is formally founded as the first fully-fledged university in [[South Asia]].
*[[1859]] &ndash; Political and state union of [[Moldavia]] and [[Wallachia]]; [[Alexandru Ioan Cuza]] is elected as [[Domnitor]] in both [[United Principalities|Principalities]].
*[[1862]] &ndash; [[Bucharest]] is proclaimed the capital of [[Romania]].
*[[1878]] &ndash; The revolutionary [[Vera Zasulich]] shoots at [[Fyodor Trepov]], the Governor of [[Saint Petersburg]].
*[[1900]] &ndash; [[Second Boer War]]: [[Boer]]s stop a British attempt to break the [[Siege of Ladysmith]] in the [[Battle of Spion Kop]].
*[[1908]] &ndash; The first [[Boy Scout]] troop is organized in [[England]] by [[Robert Baden-Powell]].
*[[1911]] &ndash; Japanese anarchist [[Shūsui Kōtoku]] is hanged for treason in a case now considered a [[miscarriage of justice]].
*[[1916]] &ndash; In ''[[Brushaber v. Union Pacific Railroad]]'', the [[Supreme Court of the United States]] declares the federal [[income tax]] constitutional.
*[[1918]] &ndash; The [[Gregorian calendar]] is introduced in [[Russia]] by decree of the [[Council of People's Commissars]] effective [[February 14]](NS)
*[[1933]] &ndash; The [[Twentieth Amendment to the United States Constitution|20th Amendment to the United States Constitution]] is ratified, changing the beginning and end of terms for all elected federal offices.
*[[1939]] &ndash; The [[1939 Chillán earthquake|deadliest earthquake in Chilean history]] strikes [[Chillán]], killing approximately 28,000 people.
*[[1942]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: The [[Allies of World War II|Allies]] bombard [[Bangkok]], leading [[Thailand]], then under Japanese control, to declare war against the [[United States]] and [[United Kingdom]].
*[[1943]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[Franklin D. Roosevelt]] and [[Winston Churchill]] conclude a [[Casablanca Conference|conference in Casablanca]].
*[[1946]] &ndash; The [[United Nations General Assembly]] passes its first resolution to establish the [[United Nations Atomic Energy Commission]].
*[[1947]] &ndash; Greek banker [[Dimitrios Maximos]] becomes [[Prime Minister of Greece]].
*[[1960]] &ndash; [[Algerian War]]: Some units of European volunteers in [[Algiers]] stage an insurrection known as the "barricades week", during which they seize government buildings and clash with local police.
*[[1961]] &ndash; [[1961 Goldsboro B-52 crash]]: A bomber carrying two H-bombs breaks up in mid-air over North Carolina. The uranium core of one weapon remains lost.
*[[1968]] &ndash; [[Vietnam War]]: The [[1st Australian Task Force]] launches [[Operation Coburg]] against the [[People's Army of Vietnam|North Vietnamese Army]] and [[Viet Cong]] during wider fighting around [[Long Bình ward|Long Bình]] and [[Biên Hòa]]
*[[1972]] &ndash; [[Japan]]ese Sgt. [[Shoichi Yokoi]] is found hiding in a [[Guam]] jungle, where he had been [[Japanese holdout|since the end of World War II]].
*[[1977]] &ndash; [[1977 Massacre of Atocha|Massacre of Atocha]] in Madrid, during the [[Spanish transition to democracy]].
*[[1978]] &ndash; [[Soviet Union|Soviet]] satellite [[Cosmos 954]], with a nuclear reactor on board, burns up in Earth's atmosphere, scattering radioactive debris over [[Canada]]'s [[Northwest Territories]]. Only 1% is recovered.
*[[1984]] &ndash; The first [[Apple Macintosh]] goes on sale.
*[[1986]] &ndash; [[Voyager 2]] passes within {{convert|81500|km|mi}} of [[Uranus]].
*[[1990]] &ndash; [[Japan]] launches [[Hiten]], the country's first [[lunar probe]], the first robotic lunar probe since the [[Soviet Union]]'s [[Luna 24]] in 1976, and the first lunar probe launched by a country other than Soviet Union or the [[United States]].
*[[1993]] &ndash; [[Turkey|Turkish]] journalist and writer [[Uğur Mumcu]] is assassinated by a [[car bomb]] in [[Ankara]].
*[[1996]] &ndash; [[Poland|Polish]] [[Prime Minister of Poland|Prime Minister]] [[Józef Oleksy]] resigns amid charges that he spied for [[Moscow]].
*[[2003]] &ndash; The [[United States Department of Homeland Security]] officially begins operation.
*[[2009]] &ndash; The storm [[Klaus (storm)|Klaus]] makes landfall near [[Bordeaux]], [[France]]. It subsequently would cause 26 deaths as well as extensive disruptions to public transport and power supplies.
*[[2011]] &ndash; At least 35 die and 180 are injured in a [[2011 Domodedovo International Airport bombing|bombing]] at Moscow's [[Domodedovo airport]].
*[[2014]] &ndash; Three bombs [[January 2014 Cairo bombings|explode]] in the [[Egypt]]ian capital, [[Cairo]], killing about 7 people and injuring over 100 others.
*  2014   &ndash; The [[Philippines]] and the [[Moro people|Bangsamoro]] agree to a [[Peace process with the Bangsamoro in the Philippines|peace deal]] that would help end the 45-year conflict.
